data.description: Econometric methods, theory, and applications. Matrix algebra will be used. Topics include linear regression, least-squares estimation, inference, and hypothesis testing. Primarily for Master's level students. It is expected that students will have completed three semesters calculus (such asMATH 234) and linear algebra (such asMATH 340).
data.title: ECONOMETRICS I

data.description: Focus on using econometric methods to address empirical questions, conduct empirical research, and write empirical papers in economics.
data.title: ECONOMETRICS III

data.description: Econometric methods, theory, and applications. Topics include instrumental variables, GMM, panel data, limited dependent variables, time series, and vector autoregressions.
data.title: ECONOMETRICS II
